net.joala.bdd.reference
Interface Reference<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the reference value
All Known Subinterfaces:
SelfDescribingReference<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ReferenceImpl, SelfDescribingReferenceImpl
public interface Reference<T>

A reference is meant to be used to be shared among steps of BDD tests written in JUnit. It is typically created before a test, filled once with a value during the tests and then can be read multiple times.

References can hold properties that can be used for later assertions.

Since:
6/5/12

Method Detail

set

void set(@Nonnull
         T value)

Set reference value. Can only be called once.

Parameters:
value - the value of the reference
Throws:
ReferenceAlreadyBoundException - if the reference already has a value
NullPointerException - if the value set is null

get

@Nonnull
T get()

Retrieve the value of a reference.

Returns:
the value of the reference
Throws:
ReferenceNotBoundException - if the reference does not contain a value yet

setProperty

void setProperty(@Nonnull
                 String key,
                 @Nullable
                 Object value)

Set a property which belongs to the reference value. Such a property might for example be a text which will be represent the reference value in a webapp. For example a username or something similar.

Parameters:
key - the name of the property
value - the value of the property
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the key is null
PropertyAlreadySetException - if you already set this property

Object getProperty(@Nonnull
                            String key)

Read the property value.

Parameters:
key - the name of the property
Returns:
property value
Throws:
PropertyNotSetException - if you did not define that property before
